column2: Acceptance Criteria - All materials conform to IFC drawings and specs- ferrules, galvanised dowels, drainage conduits etc.
Verification Record - Delivery Dockets Compliance Certificates
Acceptance Criteria - Type, size, position, chairs, cover all as specified & within tolerance; laps and splices as specified; tack welds not undercut
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure starter bars match precast stitch bars (if applicable)
Acceptance Criteria - Placement, size and configuration as per drawings ± 5mm position.
Acceptance Criteria - Cover (including tire wire) specified in drawings 0mm, + 5mm. Cover checked to FSL.
Acceptance Criteria - Surface condition free from thick rust, grease, mud etc
Acceptance Criteria - Tack Welding not within 50mm of bends
Acceptance Criteria - Mechanical splices (couplers or similar) fully engaged and installed as per manufacturers recommendations.
Verification Record - Coupler Delivery Docket, Compliance Certificates
4.7 - Formwork/ falsework setup, alignment and integrity (1)
Acceptance Criteria - Installed as per temp design; design confirmed by survey; forms clean & release agent/oil applied.
4.7 - Formwork/ falsework setup, alignment and integrity (2)
Acceptance Criteria - Falsework/formwork over 1m high has a temporary design
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete cast against concrete to be clean & free of laitance. Roughened and coarse aggregate exposed to depth of 3mm
4.11 - Cast-in items, void formers, block-outs and hold down bolts
Acceptance Criteria - Type, quantity and location as per design. Checked with survey and relevant stakeholder
Acceptance Criteria - Thermocouples installed as per VR610.22
Concrete pre-pour checks completed in accordance with the applicable ITP, drawings, specifications and approved changes
4.13 - Concrete Supply & Concrete Testing – Slump Test (1)
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete Mix on Docket Checked. Ensure delivery dockets. Tester onsite. Visual assessment of quality.
Verification Record - Concrete Delivery Dockets, Field Test Docket, Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)
4.13 - Concrete Supply & Concrete Testing – Slump Test (2)
Acceptance Criteria - 1 slump test per strength test
○ If mix contains superplasticiser, all batches shall be tested. If 5 consecutives batches comply, superintendent may reduce frequency to 1 per strength testing
○ Test within 45 mins of adding cement to aggregates, or immediately prior to discharge when actual haul time is >45mins, or after addition of water. All other slumps to be estimated visually.
Verification Record - Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)
Acceptance Criteria - Each load placed within 60mins of batching, unless approved otherwise
Verification Record - Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)
Acceptance Criteria - No water added once discharge commenced
Verification Record - Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)
Acceptance Criteria - Max and min temps:
Verification Record - Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)

Acceptance Criteria - Max. lag between trucks is <=25 mins. If > 25min aliphatic alcohol to be used. Interval between final discharge and start of discharge of next truck is <45 mins for a continuous pour.
Verification Record - Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)
Acceptance Criteria - Vertical drop not exceeding 2.0m Placed in not more than 350mm layers.
Verification Record - Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)
Acceptance Criteria - Compressive Strength Testing => 28 days post-pour
○ 3 cylinders (1 x 7day, 2 x 28 Day) taken for each sample, minimum no. of samples:
Verification Record - Concrete Pour Record (Refer pg 7)
Acceptance Criteria - Any significant deformation observed?
Acceptance Criteria - Surfaces finished to the class specified in the drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Curing in accordance with BCRC report recommendations
Verification Record - Curing Methodology or Compound: BCRC Report (attached)
4.23 - Removal of falsework and stripping of formwork
Acceptance Criteria - Falsework and formwork removed as per VR Table 610.251 (See Pg 5)
○ If early removal or loading is required, relevant approvals and test results to be reviewed by design engineer
Verification Record - RFI Reference #: Maturity Report
Acceptance Criteria - Stripped surface finish has been achieve in accordance with specifications (VR610.31) and design drawings?
Acceptance Criteria - Inactive crack and/or Patch repairs conducted as per approved procedure, where required
Verification Record - Repair method approval- RFI-Repair Product TDS

Acceptance Criteria - Cracks greater than acceptable widths as per VR Table 610.241 are mapped and repaired in accordance with VR 687 and approved methodology specific to location. Cracks requiring repairs monitored.
Exposure Classification || Maximum Acceptable Crack Widths (mm)
Verification Record - Repair method approval- RFI-Repair Product TDS
5.0 TESTING AND COMMISSIONING REQUIREMENTS – POST POUR CHECK & TESTING
Acceptance Criteria - As-built survey is within tolerance when compared to Design & Specifications
Verification Record - As-Built Record – conformance report
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete has achieved minimum strength prior to the removal of falsework/ formwork
Verification Record - Strength Achieved: Maturity Report
Acceptance Criteria - For every 25m2 of exterior surface area a 3m2 ‘Test Area’ will be selected. Within this ‘Test Area’ 10 concrete cover checks will be conducted.
Verification Record - Cover Checks Record (Refer pg 6)
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure temperature differential across the concrete member being constructed is < 20°C during the period of curing, and internal concrete temperature doesn’t exceed 75°C
Acceptance Criteria - 7 and 28 day strength results achieve min requirements as per VR table 610.051. Slump tests with tolerances.
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure works completed in accordance with IFC Dwg & Specifications, Inspection completed & recorded prior to releasing activity
Acceptance Criteria - NCR(s) raised & closed formally, All out of tolerances notified via Site NCR reporting system
Verification Record - NCR/s related to lot:
Acceptance Criteria - All RFIs have been closed-out prior to work lot submission
Verification Record - RFI & DCN Register relevant to sub-lot only
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm redline drawings are being progressively marked up
Verification Record - Redline Drawings / Summary of Material Quantities
Concrete pre-pour checks completed in accordance with the applicable ITP, drawings, specifications and approved changes
